Event.name: Exporting
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Exporter</fen> moves <fen>Goods</fen> across a border from an <fen>Exporting_area</fen> to an <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Exporter">Several companies</fex> actually make most of their income by <t>exporting</t> <fex name="Goods">goods</fex> <fex name="Exporting_area">out of the country</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>Exportation</t> <fex name="Importing_area">into nations of "special interest"</fex> is essentially prohibited.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Exporter
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The conscious entity, generally a person, that moves the <fen>Goods</fen> across a border out of the <fen>Exporting_area</fen>.
Very often, an <fen>Exporting_area</fen> will metonymically stand in for the person or persons directly responsible for the movement of the <fen>Goods</fen>. In such cases the constituent should be labeled <fen>Exporter</fen> on the first layer and with the appropriate locational FE on the second layer. <ex><fex name="Exporter">The U.S.</fex> <t>exports</t> most of its peanut products.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Vehicle
Arg.definition: <def-root>A mobile entity directed by the <fen>Exporter</fen> that holds the <fen>Goods</fen> and moves them along from the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> to the <fen>Importing_area</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Exporter</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Exporter</fen> that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. </def-root>

Arg.name: Goods
Arg.definition: <def-root>The items of value whose location is changing.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state-of-affairs that the <fen>Exporter</fen> is attempting to bring about by exporting. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that explains why the <fen>Exporter</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen> across the border. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Exporter</fen> moves the <fen>Goods</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the state of a participant during the action <ex>Kazakhstan <t>exported</t> the petroleum, <fex name="Depictive">gleeful at how much they were earning</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Importing_area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The FE <fen>Importing_area</fen> is the place that the <fen>Goods</fen> end up as a result of motion.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Path</fen> identifies the location of the <fen>Goods</fen> during transit, i.e. after leaving the <fen>Exporting_area</fen> and before reaching the <fen>Importing_area</fen>.
<ex>The <t>exportation</t> of goods <fex name="Path">across state lines</fex> is strictly prohibited.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Exporting_area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The place where the <fen>Goods</fen> are initially, before the the <fen>Exporter</fen> moves them.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. </def-root>

Arg.name: Type
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates what subtype of the general category the Exporting event belongs to.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: exportation.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the act of moving goods out of an area for purposes of sale.

lexUnit.name: export.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: send (goods or services) to another country for sale.

lexUnit.name: export [act].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the exporting of goods or services.

lexUnit.name: export [entity].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an exported commodity, article, or service.
